story.title: Campfire - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Olivia: Tell me a scary story.
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Kat‚ÄØDexter‚ÄØloves spending time with her sweet husband, their furry family, and writing stories that will tug at your heartstrings.

messages.text: Tell me a scary story.
Don‚Äôt you want to wait until I get to the Campsite?
I‚Äôm only 45 minutes away.
Plus I‚Äôm not there to protect you from the monsters üôÖ‚Äç üßü‚Äç
Lol. I mean, normally, yes, but‚Ä¶
But, what?
I‚Äôm so bored. Scott and Jessica are STILL making out in the cabin‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs been like an hour. I‚Äôm stuck out here by myself.
Don‚Äôt worry, that will be us later üòâ
Deal. Now tell me a scary story!
Okay, on a scale of one to ten, how scary do you want this story to be?
Definitely a ten!
Alright‚Ä¶but if you get too freaked out, just text me to stop.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
Okay. So, a few years ago‚Ä¶
A group of college students decided to head up north for their spring break.
They rented a few cabins, all next to one another.
Nestled in the pine trees, they were extremely isolated.
Hmmm, sounds familiar?
Maybe üòâ
The first night, they all decided to tell ghost stories around the campfire‚Ä¶
And one of the guys said that he‚Äôd heard rumors that the campground was haunted.
Really? By who?
These newlyweds. They were married on the first day of Spring.
And as a wedding gift, the husband bought his new wife the cabins.
Okay‚Ä¶what happened to them?
So, that‚Äôs the thing.
No one is really sure what happened.
One night, after their guests had gone to bed‚Ä¶
The couple decided to go for a moonlit walk.
The next morning, the husband was found, hanging from a tree.
And his insides had been torn out from his body.
The police weren‚Äôt sure who or what got him.
üò®
OMG. What happened to his wife?
That‚Äôs the other thing.
At first, everyone assumed her body would be found alongside her husband‚Äôs‚Ä¶
Or at least somewhere nearby‚Ä¶
But, as the search team continued to look deeper into the woods‚Ä¶
The more concerned they became.
You see, they reportedly heard someone singing.
Singing?
Yeah, the wife was known to have a beautiful voice.
But they never found her body‚Ä¶
I don‚Äôt get it. What happened to her?
There are a few theories.
One is that she was attacked and eaten by wild boar.
The second is that she was the one who killed her husband, as an act of revenge‚Ä¶
Revenge for what?
I thought you said they were a happy newlywed couple?
I never said they were happy.
Turns out that her husband hadn‚Äôt been faithful‚Ä¶
Allegedly, he‚Äôd brought his girlfriend up to the cabins several times.
And the wife must have found out.
No one ever gets away with cheating.
So the wife killed him, all because of THAT?
Well, yeah. Cheating is atrocious, Liv.
And as the legend goes, by enacting her revenge‚Ä¶
The newlywed wife sacrificed her soul.
What does that mean?
It means that she became a spirit‚Ä¶
The people that own the cabins now say they can hear singing sometimes.
It comes from deep in the woods.
They think the woman is still out there‚Ä¶
Haunting the woods, aiding jilted lovers, just like herself.
She cleanses it of adulterers.
By calling to them, luring them into the woods at night.
Um, that‚Äôs pretty creepy‚Ä¶
But what does this have to do with the college kids?
Well, last year, there was a disagreement between two of the couples.
Turns out that one of the girl‚Äôs boyfriends had been cheating on her‚Ä¶
With another girl in their group.
No one knew until they all got drunk on their first night.
He admitted it, right there at the campfire.
And that‚Äôs when he heard someone singing in the woods‚Ä¶
The wife!
Exactly. It was like he fell into a trance after that‚Äî
He just got up, his eyes all glassy, and he followed the melody.
And no one understood what was happening‚Ä¶
Because no one else could hear a sound besides the cracking fire.
Alone and deep in the woods, he heard the singing get louder‚Ä¶
OMG this is so creepy!
Yeah, but it gets worse.
Liv, he never made it back to the cabin.
A few friends followed after him.
They found him hanging from the same tree as the newlywed husband.
His insides had been torn out too.
It was a mirror image of what had happened nearly one hundred years ago.
WHAT?!
What about the girlfriend?
Did she sacrifice her soul too? Was she the one who murdered him?
No. She was at the firepit the whole time, so it couldn‚Äôt have been her.
As unlikely as it seems‚Ä¶
The newlywed wife must have done the dirty work for her‚Ä¶
After all, she‚Äôs always there.
Seeking revenge on the unfaithful.
Especially on warm spring nights, after the sun has set‚Ä¶
Despite the balmy temperatures, Olivia‚Äôs hands start shaking.
Because she hears a sad melody float through the air.
She looks off into the pitch-black night.
Emmett‚Ä¶
I think I hear her. I think I hear the newlywed wife.
Of course you do.
OMG I‚Äôm letting myself into the cabin. I don‚Äôt care about Scott and Jessica.
No! The door is locked.
I‚Äôm pounding on it‚Ä¶they‚Äôve got to let me in.
Emmett, why aren‚Äôt they answering me?
Wait, I can hear them. Jessica is crying.
OMG. Someone told her that Scott has been cheating on her. Who would do that?
Wait‚Ä¶
Emmett, what did you mean when you said, ‚ÄúOf course you do?‚Äù
How‚Äôd you know that I‚Äôd hear the newlywed wife?
Because I know, Liv. You can stop lying to me now.
I know you and Scott have been sneaking around behind our backs.
I‚Äôve known for a while.
No one ever gets away with cheating.
No, Emmett ‚Äî no. I‚Äôm sorry! I‚Äôm so sorry!
You‚Äôre sorry? You broke my heart!
Emmett, this is serious. Jessica just stormed out of the cabin.
And Scott ran after her.
Wait‚Ä¶WHAT?! His body just went rigid.
It looks like his limbs are made of wood‚Ä¶
Emmett, he‚Äôs walking into the forest!
Good. Sounds like Scott will get what he deserves.
Ever see a body with its insides torn out?
No! You can‚Äôt do that to him!
I‚Äôm not doing anything.
You know what I mean. The newlywed wife‚Äî
But Olivia‚Äôs limbs go rigid.
And she starts to walk, to the tempo of the ethereal song.
30 minutes later
Emmett pulls up in front of the cabins.
The campfire is almost out.
Whistling, he climbs out of his truck and starts walking into the woods.
He barely makes it a few feet before he finds Jessica, swaying by the flames.
She‚Äôs as white as a ghost, and can barely speak.
Em-Emmett.
She cocks her head to the side and stares at him with wide eyes.
Did it work?
Where are Scott and Olivia?
Jessica raises a shaky hand and points into the woods.
Then she faints at Emmett‚Äôs feet.
Emmett shrugs and continues walking, whistling all the way.
He doesn‚Äôt stop, not even when he reaches his final destination‚Ä¶
Where Scott‚Äôs body is swinging from a tree in the woods.
And Olivia‚Äôs corpse is there too, mutilated, right next to it.
Emmett takes in the looks of terror on their faces‚Ä¶
And then he smiles.
